lru-type.name: LORR
lru-type.description: The Local Oscillator Reference Receiver (LORR) is located in the receiver cabin of each antenna. It is connected, via fibre optic cable, to the ALMA Operations Site Technical Building and it demodulates the signals transmitted by the central reference distributor to provide, at the antenna, the four fundamental reference/timing signals (2GHz, 125MHz, 25MHz and 48ms).

assembly-type.name: LORR
assembly-type.description: The Local Oscillator Reference Receiver (LORR) is located in the receiver cabin of each antenna. It is connected, via fibre optic cable, to the ALMA Operations Site Technical Building and it demodulates the signals transmitted by the central reference distributor to provide, at the antenna, the four fundamental reference/timing signals (2GHz, 125MHz, 25MHz and 48ms).

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides a number of staus bits that summarize the operation of critical parts of the LORR.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point provides a number of staus bits that summarize the operation of critical parts of the LORR.

baci-property.description: Electronic Frequency Control (tuning) voltage of 125 MHz PLL. This voltage should be steady; fluctuating voltage indicates a problem.

monitor-point.description: Electronic Frequency Control (tuning) voltage of 125 MHz PLL. This voltage should be steady; fluctuating voltage indicates a problem.

baci-property.description: Electronic Frequency Control (tuning) voltage of 2 GHz PLL. This voltage should be steady; fluctuating voltage indicates a problem.

monitor-point.description: Electronic Frequency Control (tuning) voltage of 2 GHz PLL. This voltage should be steady; fluctuating voltage indicates a problem.

baci-property.description: 25 MHz RF output power level. The output power is nominally in dBm but the conversion factor between volts and power is variable. 25 MHz to FE

monitor-point.description: 25 MHz RF output power level. The output power is nominally in dBm but the conversion factor between volts and power is variable. 25 MHz to FE

baci-property.description: 125 MHz RF output power level. The output power is nominally in dBm but the conversion factor between volts and power is variable.

monitor-point.description: 125 MHz RF output power level. The output power is nominally in dBm but the conversion factor between volts and power is variable.

baci-property.description: 2 GHz RF output power level. The output power is nominally in dBm but the conversion factor between volts and power is variable.

monitor-point.description: 2 GHz RF output power level. The output power is nominally in dBm but the conversion factor between volts and power is variable.

baci-property.description: Received optical power. The actual value is a voltage representation of the photodiode receiver current.

monitor-point.description: Received optical power. The actual value is a voltage representation of the photodiode receiver current.

baci-property.description: 7 VDC voltage regulator output monitor.

monitor-point.description: 7 VDC voltage regulator output monitor.

baci-property.description: 12 VDC voltage regulator output monitor. The 12 V runs through a divide by 2 voltage divider to accommodate the ADC range.

monitor-point.description: 12 VDC voltage regulator output monitor. The 12 V runs through a divide by 2 voltage divider to accommodate the ADC range.

baci-property.description: 15 VDC voltage regulator output monitor. The 15 V runs through a divide by 2 voltage divider to accommodate the ADC range.

monitor-point.description: 15 VDC voltage regulator output monitor. The 15 V runs through a divide by 2 voltage divider to accommodate the ADC range.

baci-property.description: Negative 7 VDC voltage regulator output monitor.

monitor-point.description: Negative 7 VDC voltage regulator output monitor.

baci-property.description: The number of 125MHz clock cycles counted in the last TE on the composite signal. Since counter starts at 0, the value should be 5999999. Any other value will trigger one of the TE error flags. The counter stops at 6000000.

monitor-point.description: The number of 125MHz clock cycles counted in the last TE on the composite signal. Since counter starts at 0, the value should be 5999999. Any other value will trigger one of the TE error flags. The counter stops at 6000000.

baci-property.description: The TE OFFset counter indicates the position of the delivered TE within the analog rack as compared to the recovered timing event. When synced properly the counter will show a 2, any other count especially 0 is bad. If a bad count appears the TE will have to be resynced using 4.6.2.1 RESYNC TE.

monitor-point.description: The TE OFFset counter indicates the position of the delivered TE within the analog rack as compared to the recovered timing event. When synced properly the counter will show a 2, any other count especially 0 is bad. If a bad count appears the TE will have to be resynced using 4.6.2.1 RESYNC TE.
